intro: Disterigma baguense, commonly known as the Guiana disterigma, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in the rainforests of Guyana and Suriname. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It grows as an erect shrub, typically reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
